messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A species is a type of animal. Some species are in danger.
Breeding programmes are plans to help these animals have babies.

Zoos have a very important job today. They help with international breeding programmes. This is for species that are in danger.

In nature, these animals have problems. It is hard for them to find a partner and have babies. People might hunt them. They can lose their homes. And other animals can hunt them.

A good zoo gives these animals a safe place. They can live and have babies in the zoo.

There is another problem. Sometimes there are very few animals of one species. They become too much like a family. This is a danger for them.

Breeding programmes help with this. Animals from zoos can be put back into nature. This makes the group of animals stronger.
